Source Video

I understand this is not best-practice for html and that the preferred styling method is using CSS; however, I am using embedded HTML stylign so that I develop HTML fluency and practice problem solving that is the heart of coding. HTML is not code, according to experienced web developers, but I argue that HTML is the foundation for coding as it requires goal setting and problem solving in order to develop a webpage. There are no functions or logic processes, but there is communication between human being and software that is the essence of all coding. The "L" in "HTML" stands for "language". Drawing a parallel between development of laguage in human beings and web-development^footnote link, HTML is the development of early childhood communication where the child learns to identify the world and build mental structure. As the child develops into an adult, they then begin to develop the ability to think critically: they analyze arguments, critique them and use their own logical reasoning to formulate arguments of their own. Code, defined by classic features such as functions, is this adulthood ability to use language to build interactive and engaging communicatino beyond identification and sorting. Thus, to learn code, it is useful to use HTML as a foundation.

Useful links
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML
